headline: Jalapeno Hummus
description: Garbanzo beans, jalapeno peppers, garlic, cumin, and tahini combine to make this spicy hummus recipe that will liven up any appetizer table!
name: Jalapeno Hummus
recipeIngredient: 0.33333334326744 cup canned jalapeno pepper slices, juice reserved

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender or food processor, mix the garbanzo beans, jalapeno peppers and reserved juice, tahini, garlic, and lemon juice. Season with cumin, curry powder, and crushed red pepper. Blend until smooth.

review.reviewBody: The first time I made this, I used too many chickpeas and not enough tahini. It was hard to blend up. The second time it was perfect! I used the hot jalapeno slices that come in a jar and a pinch of cayenne instead of crushed red pepper, and it's quite spicy. I didn't have any curry powder, so I tried garam masala instead, and it works quite well. Everything else was the same.
I loved it. Its so difficult to get the tahini paste to cooperate though. But end result I is delicious
Mama likes it. I’m ok with it. Not as creamy once cold. More like a paste. Not too spicy.

Very good my whole family ate it right up with chips. Only thing I did different is I substituted Greek yogurt for the tahini because I didn’t have any and when I asked Siri what I could use for that it was a choice that I did have.

Easy to make in the Vitamin- used fresh jalapeño and sesame seeds as didn’t have tahini - the fresh jalapeño gave it a very slight green tinge and great flavour. I didn’t have curry or omitted. Found that it had a bit too much garlic for our taste. Next time I may toast the garlic first or just cut back a little. Overall I would say a very good recipe and will definitely make it again.
First of all, I’m reviewng this recipe as is. I will give it a four-star with some of the changes that I would make next time I make it
Very yummy. Made as written with a reduction in jalapeño to 1/4 cup. Have some light weights coming for dinner. Heat level is about a three aka mild, but flavorful. Great recipe. Thanks for sharing.

I have found with Hummus, it is best to mix everything but the beans together first.
Good stuff.
Used pickled jalopenos, no curry, yummy.
Great recipe, I had to add more garlic to compete with the jalapeño.

I have never been a hummus fan but it shows up often on the "Daniel Plan". This was my first attempt and I was going for flavor. I used diced jalapeno's rather than sliced. It was the best I have tried, but it did have a lot of heat. Cut the peppers down by at least 1/4 if you are not into hot dips. Bonus! All ingredients fit in my Magic Bullet mini blender. So no mess.

I made this as directed, but it didn't have a lot of flavor. Eventually, I doubled the lemon juice, added 1/2 tsp of salt, and then it became average. It was nothing special, and I was really hoping for more.
So very good! I have made it twice thus far! I tried it first with no tahini and olive oil instead - it’s what I had on hand. The tahini makes it much smoother and it’s very good!

I made the base recipe. I wasn't sure about the canned jalapeños, but had some, so I used them. I decided to substitute 1 tbsp of lemon for lime juice. I added some garlic powder, chili powder, cayenne, and some salt to taste. It turned out great! We ate the entire thing in one sitting!
We did not care for it, but our chickens sure did.
This is good - but not spicy. I think the expectation is that this will be spicy but it's really not. It just has a great flavor and a good texture to it. I'd make this again!
This was the best hummus recipe i have ever used! Only change i made was instead of 2 tbsp of lemon juice i use 1 tbsp lemon and 1 tbsp lime. IT was a hit! Thank you!

I couldnt find jalapeno hummus in our local grocery stores so decided to make it myself! Easy and excellent. I doubled the recipe and used a 16 ounce can of garbanzo beans, only 5 tablespoons of tahini(since I've never used the spice before)doubled all the other ingredients. Since we like spicy foods added crushed red pepper and jalapenos. So much cheaper than buying it in the store.

3.12.18 I used my homemade pickled jalapenos and didn’t quite have the amount specified in the recipe, so I just added more crushed red pepper flakes. I’m a fan of Madras curry powder and I’m out right now, so I used another curry powder I had in the spice cabinet which didn’t quite measure up. Still, all in all, this is a good hummus recipe, Hummus is so quick, easy and inexpensive to make I cease to be amazed at the money people pay to buy it. Served with Perfect Pita Chips also on this site.
I love that this hummus has a little kick that delivers late. I brought this to a party and it was a huge hit - one friend told me, "I have to stop eating this or I'll eat the whole bowl!"
Delicious but builds up quite a kick. Not for the timid.
Great recipe! I added a little lemon zest
YUM so delicious! Defiantly a keeper
I wasn't a fan of this. And it wasn't spice enough.

This is the recipe that made me a fan of allrecipes. It is excellent!!! I stopped buying premade hummus once I found this recipe. The heat is perfect - but not necessary for taste. You can use less and it will still be tasty.

My husband and I loved this recipe. I used the entire 15 ounce can of garbanzo beans (drained) and all the other ingredients. I added a dash more curry and cumin and a pinch of salt. I served the hummus with carrots and pita bread. Delicious!

Great recipe
Since I had 4 cups of beans, I had to make adjustments, otherwise would have followed.
I omitted the jalapenos only because I'm the only one who prefers heat, and will add later. For the 4 cups of garbanzos, I used 3 tsp Cumin, 1 tsp Curry and added lemon and tahini ingredients X4 But - I used only 2 X the garlic.
3 Tbsp EVOO smoothed it, since I had tossed the liquid

Because we like salt, I added 1 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper.

I cooked dried garbanzo beans in chicken broth and roasted 3 fresh jalapeños, then used cooking liquid to reach the correct consistency in the blender. This came out perfect! Thanks so much for the recipe!

Found husband and daughter inhaling this for breakfast this morning. Hubby tried it when I made it and declared he wasn't sharing it with our 13 and 17 year olds so he hid it in the back of the fridge. Stumbled out of bed this morning (Saturday) to find husband and 13 year old fighting over it. Making more tomorrow.

Wow this was great! I used a whole jalapeno with the seeds, and extra red pepper flakes. I would have used curry but I didn't have it. It was so creamy with the perfect amount of spiciness. Delicious!
curry overload

Love it. Up here in Alaska we like to get our heat however we can! I 'skinned' the chickpeas before they went in the food processor. Just pick 'em up and pinch--it comes right off. Seems to allow for a creamier consistency. I didn't have any curry, so I subbed coriander. Used one fresh jalapeno instead of the pickled ones, used 5 cloves of garlic instead of 3, and 1/4 ground red pepper, as that is what I had. Also added 1 tbsp chili oil and 1 tbsp of olive oil. Used about 1/3 of the bean juice, and 1 tspn of balsamic vinegar in addition to the lemon juice. Came out wonderfully creamy, not gritty, and will 'set up' nicely overnight in the fridge. Nice light color that easily garnished for serving with whatever suites your fancy. Thanks for a great one!

Do I hear a harp and tinkling bells? Am I in Heaven?? Followed the recipe exactly and I'm so glad I didn't leave out the curry, it is absolutely divine. If I could do a back flip I would be doing them right now.

Huge hit with everyone at work today! I made using all the listed ingredients, but I used two fresh jalapeños in place of the jarred. Although, I did use the juice from the jarred version. Served it with guacamole tortilla chips and crackers.
I did not have the canned jalapeno peppers so used Salsa Verde. Will add more jalapeno's next time.

Hot - this is super spicy!! For our family that's fine, but I couldn't serve this to most of our friends. With the curry and cumin, would be great paired with an Indian dish and some naan. I drained the garbanzo beans and used most of the reserved jalapeno juice. When first made, we'd give it a 5, but downgraded it to a 3 because it gets too chalky and thick when chilled.
Made this recipe to bring to a party tonight.My friends are picky and i know this will be a hit!!
This was a really good snack with some dehydrated cucumber and tomato chips.
This is a really good recipe! Nice and spicy with perfect texture.
My husband bought a large can of jalapenos so it is kind of spicy but yummy!
This was good but had to add some water and olive oil to get a correct consistency.
Awesome and spicy.... I am not a curry fan so I left it out..... oh so good!!! Thanks
Terrific!!

I used fresh garbanzo beans, replaced the tahini for olive oil and substituted curry powder for chili powder being that I did not have those 2 ingredients at hand. I made this as an appetizer for my dinner party. Everyone who liked spicy food said it was delicious! I also took some to my church members who all enjoyed the hummus and asked for the recipe.

Followed the recipe pretty accurately, except I used Thai curry paste instead of dry Indian curry and I probably poured too much pickled jalapeno juice in since the ingredients were getting stuck in the blender, but it was pretty good and very spicy! I made this in the Vitamix and it was very smoothly blended.
We make this hummus several times a month, love it!

This was really good, but it definitely needs a little salt. I didn't use canned jalapenos because we had a ton in the freezer. I just measured out the same amount and put them in the blender whole, with a little water in place of the juice, and it worked great! It was just spicy enough. My husband loves spicy stuff and I like it, but not quite as spicy as he does, and it was just the right balance so that we were both happy with it. Also, I was out of curry powder but I had some Thai red curry paste in the fridge and used that instead, but I don't think that made much difference to the recipe.
easy to make
Homemade hummus is so much better than store bought. This is a very good recipe and taste better if given a day or two to "season".
I accidentally changed it. So can't rate it. Its really good. Using it for a acorn paste that meets Dorne for a Game Of Thrones party.
yum! I did not add curry, was delicious. Made a double batch and so glad I did.
This is AWESOME. This is so much better then store bought hummus. I added half a cup extra chickpeas though because I like a thicker dip. SO GOOD.
This is my go to hummus recipe.
Very good recipe! I also added some cilantro.

This is a yummy recipe. Very easy & tasty. ...I doubled the spices because I like lots of flavor & I substituted Lime juice for Lemon. Had to add about 3 tbsp toasted sesame oil because it was too dry.

DELICIOUS! I made this for a work potluck, and it was a huge hit. The spice level is perfect, and I love the added layer of flavor from the cumin & curry powder. Wouldn't change a thing - GREAT recipe.

Very yummy! Made this without the curry powder, as I didn't have any. Just added some more jalepnos and juice to amp up the spice factor. Even my picky husband who isn't a big hummus fan enjoyed this.

Very yummy! Made this without the curry powder, as I didn't have any. Just added some more jalepnos and juice to amp up the spice factor. Even my picky husband who isn't a big hummus fan enjoyed this.

This is so good! I can't stop eating it! I doubled the recipe and it made about 2 cups. I rinsed the beans. Per other reviews, I added fresh cilantro. I also didn't have curry (and don't care much for it) so I left that out. I love that this doesn't call for olive oil. It's really good the next day when the flavors sit.
I used cooked from dry chickpeas so added some evoo and a little water to get it light and creamy. No curry this time but will try in the future.
this is sooooo goood, thank you so much, will never every buy store brought hummus again.
Warm flavor that has a little kick at the end...
Best hummus recipe I've made yet! We actually preferred it without the spices, just the first 5 ingredients.

This stuff is amazing. Do yourself a favor and make it! I used a little bit of the liquid from the garbanzo bean can and a whole (seeds and all) fresh jalapeno instead of the canned jalapenos. I like things really, really spicy so next time I might add two instead. It is soooo good. I almost ate all of it myself!

I made a few alterations, but overall a super recipe! Since I had 15oz cans of garbonzo beans I used two cans of garbanzo beans with only 1/2 cup of the juice. I used 5 tablespoons of lemon juice, 1 tsp curry, 1 tsp cumin, 3 tbls tahini and 1 1/2 jalepenos, 3 cloves of garlic and 1 tsp of sea salt. I like my hummus spicy.
This is an awesome recipe! A five star winner!,
MMMMmmm...throw some stuffed green olives in with the beans and leave out the curry and cumin...yum.

I generally do not like hummus but this one takes the cake. I have been looking for a recipe I can tolerate and this one goes beyond that!

YUMMY!!!!

This is a great recipe!! I've tried other hummus recipes from this site but this was the best!! I used 2 fresh jalapeños so since I didn't have the juice from the canned peppers I added some olive juice and slowly blended in water from the chickpeas until it was creamy. I also added salt.
I have made this dish for two parties and both times everyone loved it. The jalapeños, curry and cumin spices give the hummus a perfect amount of kick! Love this app!!!

Great hummus. I used fresh jalapenos, extra garlic, and no curry as we didn't have any. Instead of tahini I used toasted sesame oil and sunflower seed paste, again because we didn't have any on hand. Oh, the lemon juice was fresh squeezed as well.
The BEST hummus recipe ever! The only thing I did differently was buy roasted sesame tihini as that is the only brand the store in my town sold. Soooo delicious!
5 stars! This is my favorite hummus ever.
yummy
I thought this had a great flavor. I served it with pita chips and carrots. All the girls loved it, the guys well....very good recipe.
Really tasty, but way too dry. I DOUBLED the juice and added some water. It originally clogged the blender.
Followed recipe but it's very dry. My first time at making it and I wonder if I should have kept the bean water. I drained and rinsed before throwing in blender. What did I do wrong???
It is as wonderful as everyone says it is! Didn't change a thing! Can't wait to make it again!

Wonderful and sooo easy!!! I used a whole can of garbanzo beans (close to two cups), a little more than a teaspoon of each spice, 3 tablespoons lemon juice, 5 tablespoons tahini, eyeballed the jalapenos and juice (did not need to had red pepper at all) and I always add more garlic than any recipe calls for...most ingredients are always on hand so why bought the store bought?!
very good. I added a drizzle of olive oil and a little extra lemon juice because it was too dense for my blender using one can of chickpeas. I also added a handful of fresh cilantro. yum!

OMG, WOW! This is the best! The only change was I doubled the FIRST batch. I made 3 batches and frozen in party portion size. Best part is to wait 24 hours to eat and definitely ADD cilantro. You don't like cilantro, use parsley. I made both and everyone loves them each individually. THANK YOU!

Very nice versatile recipe for hummus that can be modified to suit any taste. I first made as suggested, but my own personal tastes dictate just a few changes. No tahini, less lemon juice, addition of a little olive oil for smoothness, a little more cumin and about 50% more jalapenos. Wonderful.
As with most recipes I added more garlic. To make it smooth, I added a good bit of olive oil.

Delicious and simple recipe. You'll never feel the need to buy a prepared one again! I made a couple adjustments that we found matched our preference for hummus. We used fresh jalapenos and in place of the canned juice, we added olive oil. I found that I enjoyed the silkiness of the texture. We too, left out the curry but instead added some cilantro. That made it epecially delicious if you are a cilantro lover like we are. Terrific hummus and oh so easy.

So, so awesome. I used a whole can of beans, drained, and about 3 Tbs of lemon juice - just hate to see a good lemon go to waste - and a bit more jalapenos, and omitted the curry powder as i was out. Next time I'll add it in, but hard to imagine it can be any tastier than it is now! Many thanks for posting!
Oh wow this is some good hummus!
Yumm! I used fresh jalepenos and onions and sauteed them for a minute. I put in 3 jalepenos and it is hot hot hot!
I absolutely love this recipe! It never fails and I can tweak it to be less spicy. Awesome! Awesome! Awesome! Must have tahini.
My family loved this and have requested it every time we get together.
Worth making again. It was good, not great.
i love this hummus, its just the perfect amount of spicy, wil definately make again!!
I skipped the tahini (none on hand) and used fresh minced jalapeno from my garden instead of canned. This came out delicious and was gone the next day!
Awesome! Made this for a rainy sunday (football) afternoon, everyone loved it, wouldn't change a thing!
This recipe is great! I used veggies like carrots and celery instead of pita bread. Cucumber wedges are very tastey too!
We didn't really care for this recipe. I used fresh jalapenos, and instead of tahini I drizzled in some dark sesame oil. It was kind of bitter. I think I will stick to traditional hummus.
This recipe is simple and spicy-good. I used organic garlic which makes a big difference in flavour. I used 1 fresh jalapeno instead of canned. It was quite hot but yummy.
really, really tasty!

Just made this recipe. Made it as-is, no changes. I've made several hummus recipes previously and have been very disappointed. This most definitely did not disappoint. It was way better than store bought and just as good as any restaurant I've tasted. It didn't make very much so I'm glad I doubled it.
This was the first time i made hummus and it turned out great, everyone loved it and i will make it again. I didn't add curry, and did add some water for it to blend better
